verses.kjv: Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, we want you to know about the grace of God that has been given to the churches in Macedonia.

verses.kjv: How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.
verses.ct: Even though they were going through severe hardship, their overflowing joy and extreme poverty combined to produce an incredible outpouring of generosity.

verses.kjv: For to their power, I bear record, yea, and beyond their power they were willing of themselves;
verses.ct: I can testify that they gave as much as they could afford — and even beyond what they could afford — entirely on their own initiative.

verses.kjv: Praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, and take upon us the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.
verses.ct: They actually begged us urgently for the opportunity to participate in this service to God's people.

verses.kjv: And this they did, not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.
verses.ct: What they did went far beyond what we expected. They first dedicated themselves to the Lord, and then to us, because that was God's will.

verses.kjv: Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.
verses.ct: So we encouraged Titus to complete this same work of grace among you, since he was the one who had started it.

verses.kjv: Therefore, as ye abound in every thing, in faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love to us, see that ye abound in this grace also.
verses.ct: Since you excel in everything — in faith, in speaking, in knowledge, in complete dedication, and in your love for us — make sure you also excel in this act of grace.

verses.kjv: I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.
verses.ct: I'm not giving you an order. But by pointing to the eagerness of others, I'm giving you a chance to demonstrate that your love is genuine.

verses.kjv: For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.
verses.ct: You already understand the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ — that although he was rich, he made himself poor for your sake, so that through his poverty you could become rich.

verses.kjv: And herein I give my advice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be forward a year ago.
verses.ct: Here is my recommendation on this matter: it would be good for you to follow through, since a year ago you were not only the first to give but also the first to want to give.

verses.kjv: Now therefore perform the doing of it; that as there was a readiness to will, so there may be a performance also out of that which ye have.
verses.ct: Now finish what you started. Just as you were eager to plan it, complete it with whatever resources you have.

verses.kjv: For if there be first a willing mind, it is accepted according to that a man hath, and not according to that he hath not.
verses.ct: When the willingness is there, the gift is valued based on what a person actually has, not on what they don't have.

verses.kjv: For I mean not that other men be eased, and ye burdened:
verses.ct: My goal isn't to relieve others while putting a burden on you.

verses.kjv: But by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may be a supply for their want, that their abundance also may be a supply for your want: that there may be equality:
verses.ct: Instead, there should be a fair balance. Right now your surplus can meet their need, and at another time their surplus can meet yours. The goal is equality.

verses.kjv: As it is written, He that had gathered much had nothing over; and he that had gathered little had no lack.
verses.ct: As Scripture says, 'The one who gathered a lot didn't end up with too much, and the one who gathered only a little didn't go without.'

verses.kjv: But thanks be to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.
verses.ct: Thank God that he put the same deep concern for you into the heart of Titus.

verses.kjv: For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.
verses.ct: Titus not only accepted our encouragement, but he was so enthusiastic that he came to you on his own initiative.

verses.kjv: And we have sent with him the brother, whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches;
verses.ct: Along with him, we are sending the brother who is widely praised among all the churches for his work in spreading the gospel.

verses.kjv: And not that only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and declaration of your ready mind:
verses.ct: Beyond that, he was also appointed by the churches to travel with us as we carry out this generous project — which we manage for the glory of the Lord himself and as an expression of our eagerness to help.

verses.kjv: Avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:
verses.ct: We are being careful so that no one can criticize us regarding how we handle this large contribution.

verses.kjv: Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.
verses.ct: We are committed to doing what is right — not only in the Lord's sight, but also in the sight of people.

verses.kjv: And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which I have in you.
verses.ct: We are also sending with them another brother of ours whom we have tested many times and found to be dedicated in numerous situations. He is now even more dedicated because of his great confidence in you.

verses.kjv: Whether any do enquire of Titus, he is my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren be enquired of, they are the messengers of the churches, and the glory of Christ.
verses.ct: As for Titus, he is my partner and co-worker in serving you. As for the other brothers, they are representatives of the churches and bring glory to Christ.

verses.kjv: Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.
verses.ct: Therefore, show them the proof of your love and demonstrate to the churches that our pride in you is well deserved.
